description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger, from the titles of Texts 1 and 2. Physical description: 25 lines per page. Written in small naskh (professional hand) in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within two red lines (faded to yellow on some leaves). European paper with watermark. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals (omits the first fol.; faulty). Leaves wanting between fol. 13 and 14. Inscription on the pastedown of the upper cover. Collation: Paper, fol. 178 ; 1¹⁰ (+1 at beginning of quire) 2¹⁰ (-4, two central bifol.) 3-17¹⁰ 18¹⁰ (+1, end of quire) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf ; the quires are numbered in red ink using Arabic numerals in the form "K 1" (see fol. 1a). Origin: Copied between 1 Muḥarram 1162 [Dec. 22, 1748] and 3 Ṣafar 1162 [Jan. 23, 1749] by al-ḥājj ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd Allāh (colophons, fol. 122a, 137a, 150a, 176a). The content and the name of a former owner seem to indicate a Syrian origin (al-Shām).
author: Nābulusī, ʻAbd al-Ghanī ibn Ismāʻīl, 1641-1731
former owner: Kuzbarī, ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad, 1770 or 1771-1845 or 1846
abstract: Collection of ten treatises by ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī.
contents: 10. fol. 150a-176a : Nukhbat al-masʼalah sharḥ al-Tuḥfah al-mursalah / ʻAbd al-Ghanī al-Nābulusī. -- Mach, R. and E. Ormsby. Handlist, no. 852.
extent: 178 leaves : paper ; 193 x 144 (152 x 88) mm. bound to 208 x 150 mm.
title: Wasāʼil al-taḥqīq wa-rasāʼil al-tawfīq. Taḥqīq al-maqṣūd min maʻná "Yā man huwa maʻbūd fī ṣūrat kull maʻbūd" ... [etc.].
provenance: Bought by ʻAbd Allāh ibn ʻUmar ibn Muṣṭafá ibn Ismāʻīl ibn al-muʼallif, from al-marḥūm ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Kuzbarī, muḥaddith al-Shām, 1263 H. [1846 or 7] (fol. 1a, with seal and mention of price).
creator: نابلسي، عبد الغني بن اسماعيل
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers and envelope flap. Central blind-stamped roundel on the covers. Spine and fore-edge flap repaired in red leather. Paper pastedowns. Disbound.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
